post.description:
Add an additional product or products with a quantity to an existing invoice. 

**NOTE:** Registration are now processed asynchronously by the UpBeat system so Registration objects will not be immediately available after an event product is added to the Invoice.

_This must validate, whether the member is able to add the product and fail if they cannot, (i.e. have insufficient privileges or insufficient points/entitlements etc). If the user cannot add one of the requested products the entire request should fail_

parameters.name: subscriptionPeriod
parameters.description: Specify Subscription ID for relevant pricing

get.description:
Create a new invoice in the CRM, and return an invoice response object as specified in the common JSON objects section. This function will be used when a Member/Non Member adds a product to the WEBSTORE cart for the first time.

**NOTE:** Registration are now processed asynchronously by the UpBeat system so Registration objects will not be immediately available after an event product is added to the Invoice.

**NOTE:** This request may be with GET or POST. If the invoice AND OR product line is to be created with custom data, then this data must be present in the POST body encapsulated with in an Invoice object AND OR the product line object.

_This must validate, whether the member is able to add all the products request with the create invoice call (if any) and fail if they cannot, (i.e. have insufficient privileges or insufficient points/entitlements etc)_

parameters.name: subscriptionPeriod
parameters.description: Specify Subscription ID for relevant pricing

get.description:
Get the detail of a single invoice by ID. This may include all the ticket information for on screen receipt and so a ticket can be printed. The 'Ticket' attribute may be null where product type is not a ticket.

**NOTE:** To qualify for this query the invoice transaction MUST NOT be marked as 'Exclude From Web'

post.description: Creates a payment and update invoice
Creates a payment and update invoice
Deletes a payment and update invoice
Deletes a payment and update invoice

One or more payments can be added to each Invoice. Once the total of all approved payments matches the invoice amount, the invoice within the CRM system will be paid. If the POST includes a Payment Number this will be passed in as the transaction reference. Once completed the Invoice will no longer be able to be used to add or remove products to. A new invoice will have to be created if the user wishes to purchase any more items.

Invoices may have partial payments saved. For a $100 invoice, you might have a $20 payment via Visa card plus an $80 payment via Mastercard.
The total value of all approved payments cannot exceed transaction value – you will receive an exception when trying to save any payment that would over-pay an invoice
